classes.cCustomNote: Choose one of the following: ANT201, or GEOG150.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

300-400 level courses selected in consultation with advising faculty. A written justification for the courses selected and the way they constitute a cohesive, integrated study is required. One-half of the units must be courses from the department.

If GE courses are taken for letter grade and used as concentration courses, additional free elective units may be required to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. See college advisor for additional information.
